item.title: Congress, at Last Minute, Drops Requirement to Obtain Warrant to Monitor Email
item.description: Congress, at Last Minute, Drops Requirement to Obtain Warrant to Monitor Email - AllGov http://t.co/3H64OqB8
item.content:encoded: Congress, at Last Minute, Drops Requirement to Obtain Warrant to Monitor Email - AllGov http://t.co/3H64OqB8 The federal government will continue to access Americans’ emails without a warrant, after the U.S. Senate dropped a key amendment to legislation now headed to the White House for approval. Currently, the government can collect emails and other cloud data without a warrant as long as the content has been stored on a third-party server for 180 days or more. Federal agents need only demonstrate that they have “reasonable grounds to believe” the information would be useful in an investigation. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: allgov.com

item.content:encoded: 未来の党・嘉田代表本人のものではない談話が届いた　誰が分裂を画策しているのか: 　今朝8時半頃、未来の党・嘉田由紀子代表談話と称するFAXが届いた。要約すると内容は次のとおりだ― 　（旧生活系議員から出された）「小沢一郎議員... http://t.co/IpciSRVB * 【官邸前エクスプレッション】　12月21日　自民圧勝後初の抗議集会 Link - Trackbacks

item.title: Instagram Hit With Class Action Lawsuit Related To Last Week’s Change Of Service Terms | TechCrunch
item.description: Instagram Hit With Class Action Lawsuit Related To Last Week's Change Of Service Terms http://t.co/jCvH7MQj by @catherineshu
item.content:encoded: Instagram Hit With Class Action Lawsuit Related To Last Week's Change Of Service Terms http://t.co/jCvH7MQj by @catherineshu Instagram just got a lump of coal in its stocking: a class action lawsuit, which was filed in response to its change of service terms last week. Reuters rep.. Link - Trackbacks
